intro: Ophthalmacanthus parvus, commonly known as the small-eyed thorn, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy surface. Ophthalmacanthus parvus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
